qas.question: Under which program did Eritrea develp and repair its transportation infrastructure during the war?
How long was the coastal highway between Massawa and Asseb?
What type of locomotives are sometimes used on the Eritrean Railway to cater to groups of enthusiasts?
What is the capital of Eritrea?
Which railway was rehabilitated under the Warsay Yika'alo Program?
How long is the Eritrean Railway?
How many km of war-damaged roads has Eritrea fixed?
How are most locomotives powered in Eritrea?
What is the distance between Asseb and Asmara?
What is the distance between Asmara and Massawa?

context: Even during the war, Eritrea developed its transportation infrastructure by asphalting new roads, improving its ports, and repairing war-damaged roads and bridges as a part of the <a0_0>Warsay Yika'alo<a0_0/> Program. The most significant of these projects was the construction of a coastal highway of <a1_0>more than <b5_0><b6_0><b8_0><b9_0>500 km<b9_0/><b8_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> connecting Massawa with Asseb, as well as the rehabilitation of the <a4_0>Eritrean<a4_0/> Railway. The rail line has been restored between the port of Massawa and the capital <a3_0>Asmara<a3_0/>, although services are sporadic. <a2_0><b7_0>Steam<b7_0/><a2_0/> locomotives are sometimes used for groups of enthusiasts.
